title: Derivative of a function defined as an inverse

content.prompt: Let f be a differentiable function such that f( 3 )=15 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3BE4@ , f( 6 )=3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B2A@ , f ′ ( 3 )=−8 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C25@ , and f ′ ( 6 )=−2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C22@ . The function g is differentiable and g( x )= f −1 ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4039@ for all x. What is the value of g ′ ( 3 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3971@ ?

choices.label: The value of g ′ ( 3 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3971@ cannot be determined from the information given.

unit.text: 3: Differentiation: Composite, Implicit, and Inverse Functions

skill.text: Skill 3.G: Confirm that solutions are accurate and appropriate.
